p: HSV encephalitis is the most common form of fatal encephalitis in the US. Reports of prevalance of HSV encephalitis 2, 3 suggest that it occurs from 1–2 per 100,000 persons per year in the US. A detailed survey by the Centers of Disease Control 4 for the years 1988–1997 reported an average of 2,151 hospitalizations per year for confirmed HSV encephalitis. (This may be an underestimate, because the causes of 59.5% of 18,680 hospitalizations for encephalitis were not disclosed.) Herpetic encephalitis results in high mortality, and survivors are often severely handicapped.
